positions.title: International Senior Fellow Member
positions.description:
As a CEBOT International Senior Fellow, I play a pivotal role in connecting the dynamic U.S. minority technology industry with diverse stakeholders across the African continent. CEBOT serves the collective interests of over 65,000 U.S.-based technology companies, many of which operate globally and collectively generate over $100 billion in annual economic impact.

Through this esteemed fellowship, I contribute to CEBOT's laudable initiative of nurturing and scaling African technological innovations with immense potential for significant economic and social impact. This exclusive membership is reserved for highly accomplished individuals committed to leveraging their expertise and knowledge to propel the CEBOT movement forward through collaborative partnerships and models.

My efforts are focused on bridging the gap and fostering robust trade relationships between U.S. minority technology firms and various African stakeholders. I spearhead the development, nurturing, and facilitation of trade initiatives that enhance access to technology, resources, and networks for minority technology companies seeking to expand into the African market. Simultaneously, these endeavors create a symbiotic relationship where African businesses and communities gain access to innovative technology solutions, thereby contributing to sustainable development across the continent.

Through my planned involvement in initiatives such as the International Minority Tech Roundtable and CEBOT's Tech-Africa Initiative, I hope to actively promote a vibrant ecosystem of trade, innovation, and collaboration. By fostering increased connectivity, enhanced technological access, and mutual economic growth, I am committed to ensuring that both U.S. minority technology enterprises and African stakeholders reap the benefits of this synergistic relationship.

honors.title: Early Career Academic Development Programme Award (Mentorship Programme and Grant)
honors.description:
The purpose of the ECAD mentorship programme is to accelerate the development of the next generation of productive and successful academics at Stellenbosch University (SU), through the offering of formal mentorship opportunities to a group of early career mentees.

Dedicated academic mentors will be allocated to successful candidates. These mentors will be asked to provide formal career guidance to the mentees, assisting them in becoming established academics in their chosen field. A mentor will not be the current supervisor or line manager of the mentee. The academic mentors will receive honoraria for their time spent on the mentoring process.

allData.headline: Monetary Economics Lecturer | Future Africa Fellow & PhD Candidate: SARB Chair | Ngap Early Careers | NRF Grant | Intervarsity Convenor | Golden Key | CEBOT International Senior Fellow | Financial Services Professional
allData.summary:
Mike is a Macroeconomist with cross-sector experience who worked as financial services sector professional & independent contractor for the past 15 years in different roles across the private & public sector: Analytics, business analyst, research, local economic development, insights, cvp design, customer experience, product design, strategy, commercialisation, credit risk & balance sheet analysis, brand, campaign management, marketing, budget management, banking regulation, sales, relationship management, skills training & instructional design, channel, complaints, operations, program & project management. 

Mike has a passion for Macroeconomics and Strategy who completed his Masters of Philosophy in Economics and Econometrics at the University of Pretoria (UP), doing 8 coursework modules and his thesis research project in 1 year, with Distinction  /cum laude grade and receiving academic honorary colors for outstanding academic performance as well as awarded an honorary student of the Golden Key International Honour Society. Mike received a Doctoral Research Fellowship position and Award from the South African Reserve Bank Chair in Monetary Economics studies, who is working towards completing his Ph.D. in Economics at UP, in collaboration with his co-supervisor at the University of Namur in Belgium. Mike has received multiple Top academic student awards during his career via a fully funded Norwegian Scholarship award for global exchange program to study Masters of Science in Economics courses abroad in Oslo, Norway and a fully funded Carnegie-Mellon award for an Economist bursary. 

Mike is an EE candidate, who was born on the Cape Flats then ended up studying at the University of Oslo, directed short film ads for CVP campaigns and worked as an Executive on Nedbank Wealth Management DivCo. Teach a child to fish! Mike started consulting in 2001 privately teaching Economics, mentoring and career coaching of Western Cape youth.

Mike is employed at Stellenbosch University as a Lecturer & Researcher for Monetary & Financial Economics, Convenor of Postgraduate Conferences, Industry Talks & Seminars, an International Senior Fellow of CEBOT (USA). His broad interests for networking themes include CVP, agile, corporate client strategy, macroeconomics & modelling, firm behaviour, econometrics, banking & wealth. 

Mike serves at his local church in multiple departments and enjoys CrossFit team competitions and Duathlon races with his wife. Mike  lives in Stellenbosch with his family, where his kids attend Rhenish Primary, actively participating in all sports.
